result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jason Scott Kelley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: County
superAgency.notes: 11/2/2015 - Amended Diversion Agreement filed for period time from November 2, 2015 to August 21, 2016.   Replaces Diversion Agreement entered into on August 22, 2014.  Conditions amended.

miscConds.notes:
Def's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Def shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Def will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Def shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall comply with any counseling and treatment recommendations of his primary care physician.   He shall provide the Justice Program Coordinator or designee a written statement from his provider explaining his compliance with and successful completion of said counseling and treatment.  He shall submit the written statement from his provider once in February 0f 2016 and once in July of 2016.

(Paragraph deleted regarding assessments)

Def shall write an appropriate letter of apology to the victim in this case within 3 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court; said letter shall be submitted to the Court Services Worker.

Def shall comply with any other conditions that the probation agent deems appropriate.

Def shall successfully complete probation in order to receive a dismissal at the end of the Diversion Agreement.

Def shall abide by all rules of Probation & Parole.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

supervisions.notes: **1/6/2015 - JOC amended to reflect attorney fees in the amount of $1,524.20

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to undergo an anger management assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Defendant to undergo a psychological assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Defendant to write appropriate letters of apology to victims and submit within 30 days to agent.

Comply with any conditions and no contacts per agent.

Defendant to pay court appointed attorney fees as a condition of probation.  JOC to be amended when final billing received.

**1/6/2015 - JOC amended to reflect attorney fees in the amount of $1,524.20.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
